intro: Axonopus orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco axonopus, is a species of grass native to South America, particularly found in regions such as Venezuela and Colombia. It typically grows in wetland and marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
